definition: appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
to throw oneself at/to pounce on/to devote one's energies/to flap/to flutter/to dab/to pat/to bend over

sentences.english: The same day O-nami entered the wrestling contests and won.
sentences.chinese: 這天巨浪參加了相撲比賽，他贏了。

sentences.english: It was amazing, the moment the sumo wrestlers threw the ceremonial salt into the air.
sentences.chinese: 我看到相撲選手儀式性的向場上撒鹽，真是太神奇了。

sentences.english: Wrestlers train in sumo stables here.
sentences.chinese: 相撲選手在這裏集中訓練。

sentences.english: Number-crunchers have even uncovered match-fixing in Japanese sumo wrestling.
sentences.chinese: 甚至數字玩家被發現操控日本相撲比賽。

sentences.english: During sumo tournaments, this hot pot is served exclusively with chicken meat.
sentences.chinese: 在相撲錦標賽期間，相撲火鍋專門選用雞肉爲主料。

sentences.english: During sumo tournaments, this hot pot is served exclusively with chicken meat.
sentences.chinese: 在相撲錦標賽期間，相撲火鍋專門選用雞肉爲主料。

sentences.english: While in Tokyo I attended the sumo wrestling world championship.
sentences.chinese: 在日本我去看了世界級相撲冠軍賽。

sentences.english: This is a book on Japanese sumo.
sentences.chinese: 這是一本論述日本相撲的書。

sentences.english: In the background is the gutted domed building Kokugikan, National Sumo Wrestling arena, in the Ryoguku district.
sentences.chinese: 背景圓頂建築物是両國區被燒燬的全國相撲競技場。

sentences.english: Sumo cuisine is called chanko, and the particular dish that we had is called soppu daki.
sentences.chinese: 相撲料理叫做相撲火鍋。

sentences.english: Sumo cuisine is called chanko, and the particular dish that we had is called soppu daki.
sentences.chinese: 相撲料理叫做相撲火鍋。

sentences.english: Unlike any other sport, sumo wrestling is absolutely fascinating.
sentences.chinese: 不同於任何其它運動，相撲運動絕對吸引人。

definition: ODA Nobunaga (1534-1582), Japanese shogun (warlord), played an important role in unifying Japan
Nara period (710-794) in early Japanese history
Takeshima (Korean Dokdo 獨島|独岛[Du2 dao3]), disputed islands in Sea of Japan
geisha (Japanese female entertainer)/also written 藝妓|艺妓[yi4 ji4]
Kansai region, Japan/Guanxi or Kuanhsi town in Hsinchu County 新竹縣|新竹县[Xin1 zhu2 Xian4], northwest Taiwan
Yamaguchi prefecture in southwest of Japan's main island Honshū 本州[Ben3 zhou1]
